data.title: 'Minions,' 'Elvis' reactions, an interview with Henry Thomas and more! | Streamed & Screened podcast
data.meta_description: ðŸŽ§ "Minions: The Rise of Gru" hits theaters and "Stranger Things" returns. What should you watch this holiday weekend? Listen to Streamed & Screened for options.
data.text:
Listen now and subscribe: Apple Podcasts | Google Podcasts | Spotify | RSS Feed | Omny Studio

Baz Luhrmann's new biopic "Elvis" tied "Top Gun: Maverick" at the box office this past weekend, and we've got some thoughts on all two hours and forty rhinestone-scarved minutes of its overstuffed runtime.

It's not a wildly busy weekend at the theaters with Independence Day pushing most people outside, but that doesn't mean we can't have some fun with the latest "Despicable Me" spin-off, "Minions: The Rise of Gru."

Lastly, Bruce Miller has a great conversation with Henry Thomas about his claustrophobic new thriller, "Crawlspace." Thomas is best known from his role forty years ago as Elliot in "E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial," but he's been a working actor ever since, most recently making a name for himself in Mike Flanagan's series of creepy films and shows you can find on Netflix.

Streamed & Screened is a podcast about movies and TV hosted by Miller, an entertainment reporter for multiple decades who is now the editor of the Sioux City Journal, Jared McNett, a reporter for the Sioux City Journal, and Chris Lay, the podcast operations manager for Lee Enterprises.
